name: df-lfl
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4
body: |- wceq(clfn, cmpt(s0, universe, crab(s1, co(cfv(cbs, cfv(csca, cv(s0))), cmap, cfv(cbs, cv(s0))), wral(s2, cfv(cbs, cfv(csca, cv(s0))), wral(s3, cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), wral(s4, cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), wceq(cfv(cv(s1), co(co(cv(s2), cfv(cvsca, cv(s0)), cv(s3)), cfv(cplusg, cv(s0)), cv(s4))), co(co(cv(s2), cfv(cmulr, cfv(csca, cv(s0))), cfv(cv(s1), cv(s3))), cfv(cplusg, cfv(csca, cv(s0))), cfv(cv(s1), cv(s4))))))))))
bodyPretty: ‚ä¢ LFnl =(s0 ‚àà ùïå ‚Ü¶ { s1 ‚àà((Base `(Scalar ` s0))[‚Ü¶](Base ` s0))| ‚àÄ(s2 ‚àà(Base `(Scalar ` s0)), ‚àÄ(s3 ‚àà(Base ` s0), ‚àÄ(s4 ‚àà(Base ` s0),(s1 `((s2[(√ó ` s0)]s3)[(+ ` s0)]s4))=((s2[(√ó `(Scalar ` s0))](s1 ` s3))[(+ `(Scalar ` s0))](s1 ` s4)))))})
comment: Define the set of all linear functionals (maps from vectors to the ring) of a left module or left vector space. (Contributed by NM, 15-Apr-2014.)
